Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Olga2012
Reviews.Content: Clean,small rooms, very small tv.location is good.near by Cartier shop. We didn't take the breakfast in hotel.(it wasn't included) For the same price you can find places around much better.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: artsmurphy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a week with friends in Berlin. The Precise Casa proved a really good place to stay. It was comfortable with quiet rooms facing out over a leafy car park. The location, just off Kurfurstendam and only 10 minutes walk from Savignyplatz made it ideal for a relaxed break. Near both the S and U Bahns and many excellent restaurants. The staff were all friendly and helpful. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good deal”
Reviews.Author: johanvcr
Reviews.Content: Very good modern decorated hotel a few minutes walk from the subwaystation Uhlandstr. to citycenter. Private parking behind the hotel. Breakfast buffet is perfect. Service is friendly an helpful. Two points keeps the hotel from being perfect: We were in Berlin during warm summer day's and this means a lot of loud talking an shouting people on the terrace in the street until deep in the night. (ask for a room at the backside of the hotel during summer) Second: no airco: room can be uncomfortable warm during summer nights.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel deals in Berlin, in my opinion.”
Reviews.Author: hclouv
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Casa hotel twice in summer 2008. First time travelling through from Italy back to Denmark with the family. Later on, on a weekend break with my wife. Both times it was a very nice time we spent at the hotelas well as in the city. The rooms are suitable for couples as well as small families. This is a nice little cosy botique hotel close to everything. Kudamm is only a minute away from the hotel and the U-bahn 5 minutes on foot. The rooms are modern and with free Wifi equipped. Parking is available in the backyard, believe it is 15€ a day. The breakfast is superb and not to be missed. We will definitely be back this summer! P.S: there is a petrol station further down Schluterstrase, and they have Ben & Jerry Cookie Dough icecream at a reasonable price. Not to be missed in the bed after a long day of walking around the Berlin pavements.

Reviews.Title: “Smart and central”
Reviews.Author: catgal29
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent two nights at the Casa Hotel in Berlin. We had never been to Berlin before and had no idea of the hotel's location. It turned out to be very central (in the City West) in an area known locally as KuDamm. It appears to be a fairly new hotel, apparently a one-off, and occupies 4 floors of a renovated block. The communal areas are limited to a small reception area, very small bar and a nice breakfast room. We had a delux room which was spacious and clean, decorated and furnished in a contemporary style. The bed was comfy and the room was nice and warm. Small flat screen tv, free wireless inernet access and mini-bar were available. No tea/coffee making facilities. Nice modern bathroom with swish fittings. The only downside to the room was that it you could smell cigarettes a little - the smoking ban hits Germany in 3 month's time. The breakfasts consisted of cold meats, cheeses, cereals, fruit, yoghurts, different types of bread, boiled eggs, smoked salmon - more than adequate and very tasty. Staff were friendly and the atmosphere was informal. Our room was ready when we arrived at 11am which was great. Overall, it's a funky small boutique hotel in a good location and we'd definitely stay there again. If you like hotels with big communal areas/restaurant/bar etc, this won't be for you but if you're looking for an intimate, cool hotel in the city west area, give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Nul !”
Reviews.Author: lucon
Reviews.Content: We were ready to enjoy the Casa hotel, especially after reading the good reviews on this site but we were really disappointed. First we arrived around 11.00 am in Berlin and asked for our booking but we were told by the girl at the reception (who was really unfriendly) that no room would be available before 3.30 pm. She explained that the cleaning staff was not present at that moment and that there was no manager either. I gave my mobile number to the reception girl and asked her to call me when the room was ready (hoping that this would happen before 3.30 pm). We were encouraged to have our welcome dring at the bar of the Hotel (on the ground floor) in the meantime. We visited Berlin for 4 1/2 hours...exhausted (after getting up at 4.30pm in London)...When we came back to the Hotel...no room was ready yet...so we got a little upset but we decided to go to the Bar as suggested. Down to the Bar, we gave our 'welcome drink vouchers' to the Barman. He said that the welcome drink was sparkling wine. We told him that we did not drink and he said that we would have to pay then. I argued with him that an orange juice or a glass of water was less expensive than wine but he refused my version. We also said that we would complain to the manager of the Hotel but he said that he did not care as the hotel had nothing to do with the bar... I then got a little more upset and told this barman that it was discriminatory to impose the wine on us because if I had been a muslim he would have had to serve me something else. The barman got extremely nasty, called his boss and decided to serve us one single glass of water for two... Then the nightmare went on and on and on...The service was nul and despite the great location, it takes a little more than that to make a genuine 4 star hotel. The difference always lies in the service.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Casa”
Reviews.Author: dunnard
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 6 night stay in this hotel, which is centrally located in a side street off the Kudamm. It is furnished in a very modern style throughout and we had a large room which was spotlessly clean and well equipped. The staff were friendly and the breakfast buffet was excellent with a wide selection of food. We thought our room rate was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended, very good standard”
Reviews.Author: Bobby1802
Reviews.Content: Casa is a nice designhotel, a small one, more run as a guesthouse. The lobby and reception as well as the breakfast room and bar are located in the first floor of a townhouse and the hotel occcupies the next 3 levels with rooms of all sizes. Please take into consideration that some rooms are quite small compared to US motel size, but they are nice, clean and very modern and nicely decorated. I didn´t miss anything. The breakfast is excellant and I enjoyed it very much. The location is perfect , a side street from Kudam, so it could not be better for indulging in Berlins day and nightlife. The street is quiet and there are plenty of restaurants and shops around. I´ll be certainly back again. The hotel is perfect for business and leisure as well.

HotelInfo.Name: Precise Casa Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Schlueterstrasse 40, 10707 Berlin, Germany
